message_1: Suppose a factory produces x number of widgets per day. If the raw material input to the factory is increased by 25%, what will be the new number of widgets produced per day assuming everything else remains constant?
message_2:
If the raw material input to the factory is increased by 25%, the new amount of raw material input will be 1.25 times the original amount. Assuming everything else remains constant, the number of widgets produced per day will also increase by 25%. 

Let y be the new number of widgets produced per day. Then:

y = 1.25 * x
